intro: Arrabidaea blanchetii, commonly known as the African flame tree, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Fabaceae and is characterized by its striking, fiery orange-red flowers that bloom in late winter to early spring. The plant has compound leaves with small, oval-shaped leaflets and produces pods that contain seeds covered in a sticky, resinous substance. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its vibrant floral display and adaptability to various soil types. The species is also noted for its ability to fix nitrogen, contributing to soil fertility in its native habitat.
